items.text:
AI hype says software engineering is "dead" in 2026 as tools automate routine coding, crushing junior jobs. 

Reality: demand grows 15-17%, shifting to seniors who orchestrate AI for architecture, security, and systems

Engineers evolve from coders to reviewers and designers who embrace AI fluency for high-value roles like DevOps or ML. 

What's your team's focus?

author.name: Sudhanshu Sharma ‚ú®
author.headline: AI Lead at E.ON Germany | 15+ Years in Machine Learning & Big Data | Cloud, LLM & Distributed Computing Specialist

repost_content.text:
To everyone creating doomsday scenarios for computer science jobs because of AI coding agents ‚Äî STOP.

It ain't happening.

We will need even MORE computer scientists to make these experiences safer, trustworthy, faster, and cheaper. Every new AI capability creates new problems to solve. The field of CS just got more interesting than it's ever been.

And this isn't unique to CS.

"But this time it's hitting every industry at once!"

So did the internet. It disrupted retail, media, finance, healthcare, education, and logistics all at the same time. Result? Millions of net new jobs and entire industries that didn't exist before.

Here's what the doomers keep missing: when you dramatically reduce the friction of creation, you don't destroy opportunity ‚Äî you unleash it. YouTube didn't kill Hollywood. It unlocked 50 million creators doing work that had no job category 15 years ago. Shopify didn't kill retail. It launched millions of businesses that never would have existed.

AI is doing the same thing right now. Latent creativity that was trapped behind skill barriers is about to pour out. That's not fewer jobs. That's a flood of net new work ‚Äî building, scaling, securing, and maintaining everything these new creators dream up.

Stop doom-scrolling. Start building.

author.name: Sudhanshu Sharma ‚ú®
author.headline: AI Lead at E.ON Germany | 15+ Years in Machine Learning & Big Data | Cloud, LLM & Distributed Computing Specialist

items.text:
New research from Meta Superintelligence Labs challenges how we route models for complex tasks.

The work introduces a strategy-auction framework for improving self-optimizing agents, and it exposes a problem many teams quietly run into: small agents scale poorly on hard problems.

On simple tasks, a 4B-parameter agent reaches 87% of the performance of a 32B model. On the most complex tasks, that drops to 21%.

Today‚Äôs default approaches are blunt:

Run the largest model on everything, or
Route tasks using a trained classifier
Both break down. 

Trained routers degrade as task difficulty increases, and non-predictive cascades become prohibitively expensive for agentic workloads.

The paper introduces SALE (Strategy Auctions for Workload Efficiency), inspired by freelancer marketplaces.

 Instead of choosing a model based only on a task description, candidate agents submit short strategic plans. These plans are evaluated on expected value and execution cost, and the agent with the best cost-value trade-off wins the job.

How the auction works:
1. Each agent proposes a strategy

2. A peer jury scores predicted value

3. A cost predictor estimates execution cost

4. The best value-per-cost plan is selected and executed

The self-improvement loop is the key insight. After each auction, all proposed strategies are stored in shared memory. Losing agents learn from winning plans and refine future bids, effectively upskilling over time.

Results:
Deep search tasks: +3.5 pass@1, 35% lower cost
Coding tasks: +2.7 pass@1, 25% lower cost
Overall: 53% reduction in reliance on the largest agent

Existing routing methods like WTP and FrugalGPT either underperform the largest model or fail to reduce cost. In complex coding tasks, FrugalGPT‚Äôs cost actually increases, reaching $0.61 per million tokens versus $0.36 for the best agent.

The broader takeaway:
Market-inspired coordination mechanisms can systematically outperform both single large models and traditional routing strategies, especially as task complexity increases.

Paper: arxiv.org/abs/2602.02751

author.name: Sudhanshu Sharma ‚ú®
author.headline: AI Lead at E.ON Germany | 15+ Years in Machine Learning & Big Data | Cloud, LLM & Distributed Computing Specialist

items.text:
Claude Skills are a real game üëæ

Skills make an AI far more practical and powerful in everyday use by adding focused, reusable capabilities.


‚Ä¢	They let you package complex behavior into a single named skill (for example, ‚Äúsummarise legal contracts‚Äù or ‚Äúclean and structure CSV data‚Äù).

‚Ä¢	They make workflows repeatable: once a skill is defined, you can trigger it again and again without re-explaining the whole procedure.

‚Ä¢	They improve reliability, because the steps and constraints are baked into the skill instead of relying on ad‚Äëhoc prompts each time.

‚Ä¢	They enable automation: skills can be chained or plugged into larger systems so the AI can handle multi-step tasks with less human micromanagement.

‚Ä¢	They support specialisation: different skills can be tailored to different domains (coding, marketing copy, research support, customer service, etc.) while still running on the same underlying model.

Your behavior does.

Credentials impress briefly.
How you treat people lasts.

Real impact is built in small, consistent moments.

10 ways to be someone people want to work with:
‚Ä¢ Use names and remember details

items.text:
Secure your AI agents' file access, without compromising your system.

M64GitHub just dropped ClawGate, a zero-trust engine that lets AI agents securely access your files and audit every operation ‚ö°

Free and open-source!

‚Üí Cryptographic capability tokens
‚Üí Fine-grained, time-bounded access
‚Üí End-to-end encryption + complete audit trail

Some great use cases:
#1 - I need my AI agent to interact with my codebase securely ‚Üí ClawGate grants granular file access (read/write/list) to specific paths, not your whole system.

#2 - I'm running AI agents on isolated machines (Mac Mini, VPS) & can't risk exposing credentials ‚Üí it uses self-contained crypto tokens, no mounts or shared passwords.

#3 - I need to automate sensitive workflows with full visibility & control ‚Üí every file operation is logged on your machine with cryptographic proof, and tokens expire automatically.

Check out the free, open-source repo:
‚Üí https://lnkd.in/e93EQYhd

A social platform. An AI lab. Raw compute is treated as infrastructure. And then one company to run them all.

Each move, on its own, looks like a bet. Together? They reveal something much bigger.
This isn't about AI hype. It's about vertical integration at a scale we haven't seen before. It's about controlling the data, the models, and the infrastructure, all under one roof.

Sound familiar? It should. It's the same playbook behind Tesla and SpaceX. 

is this the future of tech, or is consolidation the biggest risk we're not talking about?

items.text:
Unify your AI Agent's brain, without the context chaos.

Tired of fragmented memories, scattered resources, and unobservable skills for your AI Agents? ByteDance's Volcengine just open-sourced OpenViking, a game-changing Context Database that organizes all your Agent's needs with a powerful filesystem paradigm ‚ö°

Free and open-source!

‚Üí Filesystem paradigm for unified context
‚Üí Tiered loading (L0/L1/L2) for cheap tokens
‚Üí Recursive retrieval for precise context
‚Üí Visualized pathways for observable debugging
‚Üí Automatic session memory for self-evolving Agents

Some great use cases:
#1 - I want to manage all my Agent's context (memory, resources, skills) in one place ‚Üí OpenViking unifies it all with a familiar filesystem.

#2 - I need to keep costs low and avoid info loss with large contexts ‚Üí it uses tiered loading to reduce token consumption.

#3 - I need my Agent to find *exactly* what it needs, accurately ‚Üí its recursive retrieval digs deep for precision.

#4 - I need to debug why my Agent isn't retrieving correctly ‚Üí visualize the retrieval path for clear insights.

#5 - I want my Agents to get smarter over time ‚Üí it automatically evolves their memory and skills.


Check out the free, open-source repo:
‚Üí https://lnkd.in/ens-_BPd

CEO of Shopify, Tobi Lutke has open-sourced `QMD`, a local indexing tool that transforms how you find information in your notes and documentation ‚ö°

Free and open-source!

‚Üí Local & private search
‚Üí Hybrid BM25 + vector search

Some great use cases:
#1 - I want to quickly find specific info in my notes ‚Üí `qmd` uses BM25 for fast, accurate keyword matching.

#2 - I need to recall concepts from my knowledge base ‚Üí `qmd`'s vector search understands semantic similarity for conceptual queries.

#3 - I'm using LLMs and need to reduce context tokens ‚Üí `qmd` returns only relevant snippets, saving up to 96% tokens.

#4 - I want to keep my search private and local ‚Üí all indexing and search happens directly on your machine.

items.text:
Anthropic just released Legal Plugins for Claude üìÉ 

These new tools allow Claude to connect directly with trusted legal data sources, which gives lawyers, paralegals, and legal teams access to accurate, real-time information inside their workflow.

author.name: Sudhanshu Sharma ‚ú®
author.headline: AI Lead at E.ON Germany | 15+ Years in Machine Learning & Big Data | Cloud, LLM & Distributed Computing Specialist

items.text:
Smart people don't fail by falling short.

They fail by excelling at things that don't matter.

author.name: Sudhanshu Sharma ‚ú®
author.headline: AI Lead at E.ON Germany | 15+ Years in Machine Learning & Big Data | Cloud, LLM & Distributed Computing Specialist

repost_content.text:
This quote about cats, mice and lions has been living rent free in my head for two weeks now. Let me explain why...

A smart person's biggest risk isn't failing, it's being successful at the wrong things.

There is a version of slow motion failure that feels like success; staying busy with stuff you can do with your eyes closed, achieving small goals, being so full of easy wins that you have no appetite left for bigger ones.

One thing I've noticed after hundreds of interviews is that the best founders are unusually good at saying no to mice. Easy revenue. Low hanging fruit. Tempting side quests.

They've figured out something that takes most people years to learn: the cost of an easy win is non-obvious.

One distraction won't change your trajectory. The problem is they arrive one at a time - each one too small to refuse, each one quick enough to give you the dopamine hit of progress.

A few hits is all it takes to develop a preference for them. And that preference will change your trajectory.

Most people don't miss the big prizes because they weren't capable - they miss them because they couldn't give up their addiction to small ones.

author.name: Sudhanshu Sharma ‚ú®
author.headline: AI Lead at E.ON Germany | 15+ Years in Machine Learning & Big Data | Cloud, LLM & Distributed Computing Specialist

items.text:
Why 80% of Your Apps Might Disappear Soon

We've been living in a "browser tab prison" for years. 

We open one app for fitness tracking, another for travel, another for smart home control. But what if one AI assistant could replace most of them?

Peter Steinberger  built¬†OpenClaw -  "an AI that lives on your computer and can access your files, APIs, and tools. It's not just another chatbot. It's a "weird friend" that can actually do things."

On a birthday trip, Steinberger got a tweet about a bug in his code. Without opening his laptop, he:

- Screenshotted the tweet
- Sent it to his AI via WhatsApp
- The AI read it, found the bug, fixed the code, committed the changes, and replied to the user on Twitter

All from his phone. No laptop needed.

The Problem for SaaS Companies:

80% of apps could "melt away"¬†because they're just interfaces for things AI can do directly:

Fitness apps?¬†The AI saw Steinberger at KFC and "roasted" him based on his 
fitness goals - no manual logging needed.

Travel apps?¬†OpenClaw handled British Airways check-in by finding his passport in Dropbox and filling out the forms.

Smart home apps?¬†It reverse-engineered Eight Sleep and Philips Hue APIs to control his bed and lights through chat.

Food delivery apps?¬†It tracks orders by accessing delivery service APIs.
Why This Changes Everything

If it has an API, it can be absorbed¬†- The AI becomes the interface

Persistent memory¬†- Unlike separate apps, it remembers your preferences across everything

Custom solutions¬†- Even non-technical users can build their own "skills" instead of buying SaaS subscriptions


When one AI can see your location, access your files, control your devices, and learn your habits - why open dozens of separate apps?

These "self-contained little apps" are a layer that will "slowly melt away." We'll just talk to one assistant that handles everything.

If your product is just a GUI on top of an API, you're competing with an AI that already has access to that API and knows everything about the user.

What do you think? 

#AI #SaaS #Technology #Innovation #FutureOfWork
video credits: Peter Yang

author.name: Sudhanshu Sharma ‚ú®
author.headline: AI Lead at E.ON Germany | 15+ Years in Machine Learning & Big Data | Cloud, LLM & Distributed Computing Specialist

repost_content.text:
You can replace a position. You can never replace a person. Yet too many leaders treat employees like replaceable resources then wonder why there's no loyalty. Trust and loyalty‚Äîthe true backbone of any thriving team‚Äîcan‚Äôt be bought. They‚Äôre earned through consistent care, meaningful recognition, and real support. No amount of perks can compensate for feeling invisible or stuck. If people don‚Äôt feel valued and see no room for growth they‚Äôll leave‚Äîno matter the paycheck.

Pick up a copy of my new book. "LEADING IN THE AGE OF AI." üëâ https://lnkd.in/e97NsiMP

items.text:

Inspired by Andrej Karpathy's insights on LLM coding pitfalls, this resource helps your AI act like a senior engineer.

Free and open-source!

‚Üí Eliminate wrong assumptions & hidden confusion
‚Üí Prevent overcomplicated, bloated code
‚Üí Ensure focused, surgical code changes
‚Üí Drive reliable results with verifiable goals

Some great use cases:
#1 - My LLM generates bloated code ‚Üí The Simplicity First principle cuts through over-engineering.

#2 - My LLM makes assumptions instead of asking ‚Üí Think Before Coding forces explicit reasoning and clarification.

#3 - My LLM touches unrelated code or comments ‚Üí Surgical Changes keeps edits precise and minimizes side effects.

#4 - I need my AI's code outputs to be consistently reliable ‚Üí Goal-Driven Execution transforms tasks into verifiable success criteria.

author.name: Sudhanshu Sharma ‚ú®
author.headline: AI Lead at E.ON Germany | 15+ Years in Machine Learning & Big Data | Cloud, LLM & Distributed Computing Specialist

items.text:
You Were Never Hired to Complete Tasks

Your job wasn't writing code. It was solving problems that mattered. Code was just the tool.

AI cutting your coding time by 80%? That's not replacement, "it's liberation". 

Now you have time for what actually requires human intelligence: understanding the real problem, architecting solutions that scale, asking questions others miss.

The anxious developer sees obsolescence.
The strategic developer sees focus.
This pattern extends everywhere.

Marketers decode human behavior. The copy is just output.
Designers solve user problems with elegance. Pixels are just the medium.

Leaders create alignment toward a vision. Meetings are just mechanics.
The task has never been the point.

Tools evolve constantly from punch cards to assembly to Python to AI agents.

What endures: judgment, systems thinking, the capacity to identify genuine 
problems and solve them with insight.

Task-focused workers face disruption.

Purpose-focused workers create value AI can't touch.
Where do you stand?

items.text:
We're putting Gemini to work in¬†Chrome¬†to make the web more helpful.

Here‚Äôs a look at what‚Äôs new:

üëâ A reimagined side panel for multitasking: The new side panel ensures Gemini is always available as your assistant, no matter what tab you‚Äôre in. It helps you multitask without interruption, letting you summarize reviews, compare products, or check your calendar while keeping your primary work open.

üëâ The creative power of Nano Banana directly in the browser: You can now transform images on the fly, like turning data into infographics, without needing to download files or switch tabs.

üëâ Personal Intelligence for proactive help: Coming soon, Personal Intelligence will turn¬†Chrome¬†into a trusted partner that understands your context. It remembers past conversations to provide uniquely tailored answers and connects with your Google apps. You can opt-in and choose whether to connect your apps and disconnect them at any time.

üëâ Agentic capabilities with auto browse: We‚Äôre also introducing "auto browse" to handle complex, multi-step tasks for you, from researching travel itineraries to filling out forms.

These features are rolling out now on Windows, MacOS, and Chromebook Plus in the U.S., with auto browse available in preview for Pro and Ultra subscribers.

Read more about the updates here: https://lnkd.in/gnBCfaMT

author.name: Sundar Pichai
author.headline: CEO at Google

items.text:
TeleAI Launches TeleStyle: a lightweight Advanced Style Transfer Model

TeleStyle, a new model for applying artistic styles to images and videos while preserving original content. Built on Qwen-Image-Edit.

Key Features:
- Video and image stylization
- High-quality real-world style dataset
- Curriculum Continual Learning framework
- State-of-the-art performance in similarity, consistency, and aesthetics

Resources Available:
- Research paper:  https://lnkd.in/dV8B7bnR 
- Open-source code and model: https://lnkd.in/dcTtwbiJ
- Project page with demos: https://lnkd.in/djumhwtT

The model balances lightweight architecture with strong content preservation and style customization capabilities.

items.text:
Unleash the full power of your Moltbot AI assistant! ‚ö°

I have developed a directory of Moltbot (Clawdbot) Skills called `awesome-moltbot-skills`, an epic collection that supercharges your locally-running AI.

This massive community-built skill registry gives your Moltbot (formerly Clawdbot) 565+ ways to interact with external services, automate workflows, and crush specialized tasks.

Free and open-source!

‚Üí 565+ community-built skills
‚Üí Seamlessly extends Moltbot's capabilities
‚Üí Follows Anthropic's Agent Skill convention
‚Üí Easy installation via ClawdHub CLI or manual install

Some great use cases:
#1 - I want my local AI to do more ‚Üí Moltbot Skills connect it to dozens of apps, services, and APIs, from GitHub to Spotify.
#2 - Need custom automations? ‚Üí Dive into categories like DevOps, Marketing, Productivity, and Browser Automation to build specialized workflows.
#3 - Just want to contribute my own tool? ‚Üí Publish your skill to ClawdHub and join the open-source movement!

Check out the free, open-source repo:
‚Üí https://lnkd.in/dW-U_hSz

China waves hello to Nvidia‚Äôs H200 chips, balancing AI dreams with a dash of strategic domestic development!

Latest AI and tech news - 2026-01-29:

‚Ä¢ The creator economy faces significant payment delays from brands, posing a persistent financial challenge. [Digiday] (https://lnkd.in/dahsbipG)

‚Ä¢ Nyxi introduces execution-time governance to prevent unintended irreversible actions by autonomous AI agents, crucial for responsible AI. [Github.com] (https://lnkd.in/dYSDsP83)

‚Ä¢ ModifyWithAI v2 enables developers to embed chat-based AI agents into apps, allowing users to complete complex multi-step tasks via conversation. [Modifywithai.com] (https://modifywithai.com)

‚Ä¢ "momex", a new memory system for AI agents with Structured RAG capabilities, is now on PyPI. [Pypi.org] (https://lnkd.in/dGNTAQNe)

‚Ä¢ The "browser-use" PyPI project enhances AI agents' ability to access and interact with websites. [Pypi.org] (https://lnkd.in/dEd6NSRK)

‚Ä¢ An Azure AI Agents server adapter framework is now on PyPI, streamlining AI agent integration with Microsoft's Azure AI ecosystem. [Pypi.org] (https://lnkd.in/dbYjFtfE)

‚Ä¢ RationalBloks introduces an enterprise-grade MCP Server on PyPI to seamlessly connect AI agents with existing backend projects. [Pypi.org] (https://lnkd.in/dydKg2cY)

Stay healthy and stay updated!
